verbose_text: Studies have demonstrated that osteoblast adhesion to matrix proteins, such as type I collagen and fibronectin, through integrin receptors located in focal adhesions is necessary for their differentiation [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
evidence: adhesion to matrix proteins, such as type I collagen and fibronectin, through integrin receptors located in focal adhesions is necessary for their differentiation
